name: Spiced Beef Jerky
description: A savory, oven-dried beef jerky seasoned with cumin, coriander, and a cracked pepper kick.
keywords: Beef Jerky, High Protein, Snack, Oven Dried, Keto
recipeIngredient: 350g Lean Beef (e.g., silverside, topside, or eye of round)

recipeInstructions.name: Cut Beef
recipeInstructions.text: Trim the beef of excess fat and sinew. Cut the beef to your desired width (I prefer 3-5mm) and your desired way (with or against the grain). Personally I prefer mine to be cut against the grain that way its easier to eat.

recipeInstructions.name: Mix
recipeInstructions.text: Mix the beef thoroughly with the other ingredients and refrigerate for about 30 minutes. Mix the beef again and refrigerate for another 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep for Oven
recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 80Â°C. Strain beef and squeeze out excess soy sauce (stops it from being too salty). Lay beef out on racks ensuring it does not overlap.

recipeInstructions.name: Dry
recipeInstructions.text: Dry out in the oven for about 3-5 hours depending on thickness and desired dryness. Personally I like mine thin and dry so I go for about 4-5 hours. I would check it at about 2-3 hours just to see how its going.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep for Oven
recipeInstructions.text: Once you take it out of the oven it will continue to dry so take that into account. Once its cooled down on the bench (don't cover during this) its ready to store in the fridge!

notes: Add a bit of cayenne and you've got the BBQ wings spice mix on your hands, a winner!
